A method, comprising:receiving, by a power management component of a memory device, a first supply voltage having a first voltage level from a memory system;outputting a second supply voltage to a memory die of the memory device based at least in part on receiving the first supply voltage, the second supply voltage having a second voltage level different than the first voltage level of the first supply voltage;measuring a third voltage level of the second supply voltage at a location on the memory die based at least in part on outputting the second supply voltage; andoutputting the second supply voltage having a fourth voltage level different than the second voltage level based at least in part on measuring the third voltage level at the location on the memory die.

3. The method of claim 2, further comprising:determining the fourth voltage level of the second supply voltage based at least in part on the third voltage level, wherein outputting the second supply voltage having the fourth voltage level is based at least in part on determining the fourth voltage level.

4. The method of claim 2, further comprising:adjusting the second voltage level of the second supply voltage to the fourth voltage level based at least in part on measuring the third voltage level, wherein outputting the second supply voltage having the fourth voltage level is based at least in part on adjusting the second voltage level.

5. The method of claim 2, further comprising:outputting a plurality of second supply voltages to the memory die of the memory device based at least in part on receiving the first supply voltage, the plurality of second supply voltages having one or more second voltage levels different than the first voltage level of the first supply voltage, wherein the plurality of second supply voltages comprises the second supply voltage.

6. The method of claim 2, further comprising:receiving, by the power management component, a signal indicative of a measured condition of the memory device based at least in part on measuring the third voltage level of the second supply voltage at the location on the memory die, wherein outputting the second supply voltage having the fourth voltage level different than the second voltage level is based at least in part on receiving the signal indicative of the measured condition of the memory device.

7. The method of claim 6, wherein the signal indicative of the measured condition of the memory device comprises the third voltage level, an indicator of whether the third voltage level is higher or lower than a target range, an indicator that the third voltage level is outside of the target range, or any combination thereof.
8. The method of claim 2, wherein the power management component is coupled with a substrate of the memory device and comprises at least a portion of a package of the memory device.
9. The method of claim 2, wherein measuring the third voltage level is performed by one or more sensors on the memory die of the memory device.

10. A non-transitory computer-readable medium storing code, the code comprising instructions executable by a processor to:receive, by a power management component of a memory device, a first supply voltage having a first voltage level from a memory system;output a second supply voltage to a memory die of the memory device based at least in part on receiving the first supply voltage, the second supply voltage having a second voltage level different than the first voltage level of the first supply voltage;measure a third voltage level of the second supply voltage at a location on the memory die based at least in part on outputting the second supply voltage; andoutput the second supply voltage having a fourth voltage level different than the second voltage level based at least in part on measuring the third voltage level at the location on the memory die.

11. The non-transitory computer-readable medium of claim 10, wherein the instructions are further executable by the processor to:determine the fourth voltage level of the second supply voltage based at least in part on the third voltage level, wherein outputting the second supply voltage having the fourth voltage level is based at least in part on determining the fourth voltage level.

12. The non-transitory computer-readable medium of claim 10, wherein the instructions are further executable by the processor to:adjust the second voltage level of the second supply voltage to the fourth voltage level based at least in part on measuring the third voltage level, wherein outputting the second supply voltage having the fourth voltage level is based at least in part on adjusting the second voltage level.

13. The non-transitory computer-readable medium of claim 10, wherein the instructions are further executable by the processor to:output a plurality of second supply voltages to the memory die of the memory device based at least in part on receiving the first supply voltage, the plurality of second supply voltages having one or more second voltage levels different than the first voltage level of the first supply voltage, wherein the plurality of second supply voltages comprises the second supply voltage.

14. The non-transitory computer-readable medium of claim 10, wherein the power management component is coupled with a substrate of the memory device and comprises at least a portion of a package of the memory device.
15. The non-transitory computer-readable medium of claim 10, wherein measuring the third voltage level is performed by one or more sensors on the memory die of the memory device.

16. An apparatus, comprising:a memory die of a memory device for storing data;a power management component coupled with the memory die; anda controller coupled with the memory die and operable to cause the apparatus to:receive a first supply voltage having a first voltage level from a memory system;output a second supply voltage to the memory die based at least in part on receiving the first supply voltage, the second supply voltage having a second voltage level different than the first voltage level of the first supply voltage;measure a third voltage level of the second supply voltage at a location on the memory die based at least in part on outputting the second supply voltage; andoutput the second supply voltage having a fourth voltage level different than the second voltage level based at least in part on measuring the third voltage level at the location on the memory die.

17. The apparatus of claim 16, wherein the controller is operable to cause the apparatus to:determine the fourth voltage level of the second supply voltage based at least in part on the third voltage level, wherein outputting the second supply voltage having the fourth voltage level is based at least in part on determining the fourth voltage level.

18. The apparatus of claim 16, wherein the controller is operable to cause the apparatus to:adjust the second voltage level of the second supply voltage to the fourth voltage level based at least in part on measuring the third voltage level, wherein outputting the second supply voltage having the fourth voltage level is based at least in part on adjusting the second voltage level.

19. The apparatus of claim 17, wherein the controller is operable to cause the apparatus to:output a plurality of second supply voltages to the memory die based at least in part on receiving the first supply voltage, the plurality of second supply voltages having one or more second voltage levels different than the first voltage level of the first supply voltage, wherein the plurality of second supply voltages comprises the second supply voltage.
20. The apparatus of claim 16, wherein the power management component is coupled with a substrate of the memory device and comprises at least a portion of a package of the memory device.
21. The apparatus of claim 16, wherein measuring the third voltage level is performed by one or more sensors on the memory die.
